lexUnit.name: click.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a short, sharp sound as of two metallic or plastic objects coming smartly into contact

sentence.text: Then , the sound so magnified by the water that it made us start , came the click and creak of a door opening nearby , and the soft ripple of a boat moving through the water .
There was a sharp metallic click and as Dan stood up , Patrick saw him slip the heavy pistol back into his pocket .
I asked Edwards whether putting this on for the unveiling -- maximization for the sponsor , the click and clack of computer keys tapping -- had been part of the deal .
Instantly there was the loud click and hum of automatic weapons being readied .
There was a click and she 'd gone , and I could hardly believe that I 'd ever doubted her as a relay post .
There was a loud metallic click and the whole section of wall swung outwards .
A second later there was a loud click and buzz which could only be the black box alarm being activated .
The louder it is , the more distant the object it can detect and the bats produce clicks which , if translated into frequencies that we can hear , would sound as loud as a pneumatic drill .
Just before each Geiger counter click we see a flash of light from the illuminated electron .
Isabel Lavender heard the click of the door , her sister 's sharp footsteps , the latch of the gate .
The rest of the squad fell to one knee , and I heard the smart click of rifle bolts â€¦
She heard the click of the gate ; then nothing , except the crickets rubbing their back legs together in the grass .
The sound of corks popping at Number Ten Downing Street -- ` warm congratulation " , ` another first for Britain " -- echoes the click of particles at CERN .
Why , even the little perspex boxes , snapping open and shut with the chic click of a silver cigarette case , have been designed for maximum tactile jouissance .
As I stepped down the steep treads I heard the too loud click of shoe leather on metal .
Below the soft throb of the music , his increased sense of hearing had picked up the quiet click of the outer door to his private suite being closed .
The Editor found it pleasing to think of office workers relaxing in the saloon 's comfortable armchairs and listening to music for a while instead of the click of typewriters .
The click of the misfire , as the hammer snapped home on the dud cartridge , was all the warning Angel One needed .
There was no sound , except the occasional click of a twig falling to the ground .
Her voice went up three tones on the last words , she sniffed loudly and I heard the click of her handbag .
At that moment there sounded the unmistakable click of the key turning in the front door .
There was a click of the door as it closed behind her .
Penetrating her sleep she had heard the faint click of the door latch , and then the familiar squeak of the hinge as the door to her room slowly opened .
When they were left alone , a silence descended , broken only by the click of silver against porcelain as Jake helped himself to sugar and stirred .
He had seen it happen , like a click of the fingers , the start of life , when the foal opened its eyes and looked at him .
Huy listened to him descending them , then the soft creak and click of the door .
Around him in the eating house a few other diners sat , chatting quietly , and from the next table came the muted click of the pieces being moved by two players of twenty-squares .
Clenching her teeth she pulled the door behind her , heard the sharp click of the Yale lock that shut her out .
With a click of his tongue , Henry Skipton pulled himself together .
And from a yellow door issued a man in a white coat , and the eyes of his harem of suppliants went to him , the click of knitting needles hesitated and pages of rustling magazines halted .
The click of Misch 's polished heels interrupted Goebbels ' reflections .
A dolphin is able to produce sonar clicks by forcing air through special passages and sinuses in its head .
Below on the street the sobbing girl let the boy comfort her , then behind us there was a click from the balcony door .
` Dinner in half an hour -- be ready , " he said curtly as his door closed behind him with a decisive click .
` Yes , just rest completely , Faye , " Belinda agreed , as she pressed the door home with a gentle click .
She was heard to pause before going into the bathroom , the latch of which gave its distinctive click .
But this time there was only a disappointing click ; not even the percussion cap fired .
The room was silent as she scrabbled in her box of pieces and , from the very bottom , produced a couple that she set down on the board with two decisive clicks .
She looked up , simultaneously snapping shut the snuff-box , so that the movement of her head seemed to be responsible for the accompanying sharp click .
At the third corpse there was a faint click , and she looked up as the music stopped .
She gave a little crow of triumph when suddenly there was a sharp click , and the panel opened like a tiny door .
The blade snapped open with a soft click .
In both cases the sounds are audible to humans , not ultrasonic like the more specialized bat clicks .
The brass reel gave a tentative click .
Dolphins emit rapid trains of high-pitched clicks , some audible to us , some ultrasonic .
The bat 's air-borne clicks bounce off insects , whereas water-borne sounds pass through the tissues of a fish to the bone and swim bladder .
The oilbird 's click lasts for about a hundredth of a second and is not a single sound but a burst of pulses , each only about a thousandth of a second long .
